result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tai Keungsavath

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence, filed.

Defendant Tai Keungsavath in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Morgan Adams in court for Tai Keungsavath.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for Jon Josephsen for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for motion hearing.  Arguments heard.  Court placed on the record, findings of fact and legal analysis. For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the Defense Motion for Disclosure of Identity of Confidential Informant.  Defense requests further motion hearing date.  Court sets 10/13/2022 deadline for Defense to file its motion and 11/14/2022 deadline for State to file its response.  Case remains calendared in Branch 9.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Disclose CI Identity, filed.

Attorney Daniel Morgan Adams in court, defendant Tai Keungsavath not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for Attorney Alexander Dyer for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Pre-trial conference. Defense has received all discovery from the State. Defense has filed a Motion for Disclosure of Identity of Confidential Informant.  Court sets 8/30/2022 deadline for State to file a response to the Motion. Defendant shall be produced for next hearing date.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 10:30 am.
/for Disclosure of Identity of Confidential Informant, filed.

Attorney Daniel Morgan Adams in court, defendant Tai Keungsavath not in court, in custody, appearance wavied.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets 07/01/2022 for the deadline for the State to confirm all discovery, with the exception of crime lab reports, has been turned over to Defense. Court sets 08/05/2022 for the deadline to file any motions or change of plea forms. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Tai Keungsavath in court with Attorney Daniel Morgan Adams; both appear by video.  Defendant Tai Keungsavath in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Motion to Adjourn Time of Preliminary Hearing Until Afternoon.

Adjustment Number: 22A 044585,
Payable Number: 1005431,
Receipt Number: 22RP018773,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Tai Keungsavath not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tai Keungsavath in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Tai Keungsavath in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tai Keungsavath appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
